content: The Representation of the People Act (RP), 1951 mandates that only qualified candidates can contest an election. However, the process of verifying said qualifications has accumulated complexity over the years, with too much importance being laid on procedural technicalities than actual ‚Äòdefects of a substantial character‚Äô

content: While AICTE permission is mandatory for government, aided and private engineering colleges to start new courses and enhancement of seats, policy loopholes are leading to an imbalance in engineering seats in Karnataka with private universities having no such obstacles, writes Jayanth R.

The dust has settled somewhat, but the villagers‚Äô complaints about pollution persist. Mithosh Joseph attempts to get to the bottom of the issue

content: The system, which displays glucose readings directly on the patch, is designed to function on low power, extending battery life and reducing the frequency of charging

content: Supplied within reasonable time, this is irrespective of the nature of the offence or statute involved, the apex court has held

content: Chief Minister will today hold separate meetings in Bengaluru with representatives of protesting sugarcane farmers and owners of sugar factories

title: SIT arrests former Thiruvabharanam Commissioner in Sabarimala gold theft case
content: K.S. Baiju, who retired as the Thiruvabharanam Commissioner of the Travancore Devaswom Board (TDB) in July 2019, is the seventh accused in the case. Investigators say that Baiju committed a deliberate lapse by being absent from Sabarimala while gold-plated copper plates on the Dwarapalaka idols were dismantled and handed over to the sponsor of the gold-plating work in 2019

title: Woman with muscular dystrophy to appear for equivalency exam at home
content: Permission given considering the 32-year-old Thrissur native‚Äôs case as a special one, says Sivankutty

title: Bihar polls: flooded roads, 20-year wait for booth to return to village as voters bat for democracy
content: In Darbhanga‚Äôs Kusheshwar Asthan constituency, voters braved flooded roads and difficult terrain to cast their votes, many with their children in tow; in Munger‚Äôs Bhimbandh, part of the Maoist-hit Tarapur seat, residents queued up with visible relief and excitement as a polling booth had finally returned to their village after 20 years

title: IIT Patna student wins hackathon
content: Adhithyan V.P. wins first prize for developing an artificial intelligence-powered co-pilot that unifies Jira, GitHub, and Teams to predict risks, optimise workloads, and ensure compliance through intelligent automation

title: Air India crash: SC tells pilot‚Äôs father ‚Äòyou shouldn‚Äôt carry burden on yourself‚Äô
content: The Supreme Court has stated that the pilot-in-command of the Air India Boeing Dreamliner that crashed in Ahmedabad, killing 260 people, is not to be blamed. The apex court assured the pilot's 91-year-old father that his son is not at fault, calling the incident an accident. A notice was issued to the Centre and DGCA regarding the father's plea for a fair investigation.

title: Footballer gives up Australian citizenship to play for India
content: Anglo-Indian footballer Ryan Williams, with Australian citizenship, has embraced his Indian roots by obtaining an Indian passport. This significant move makes the 32-year-old eligible to represent India's national team, fulfilling a lifelong ambition and honoring his grandfather's legacy. Williams aims to inspire other foreign-born players to consider playing for India.

title: Deepfake scam: B'luru police probe AI videos of Kohli, Nirmala Sitharaman; case filed
content: Bengaluru cybercrime police have filed a suo motu case against unidentified individuals for creating and circulating AI-generated deepfake videos. These videos falsely depict prominent personalities like Virat Kohli and Nirmala Sitharaman endorsing fraudulent stock trading platforms and online games, aiming to lure unsuspecting victims into investment scams.

title: 'Had a habit of ...': Bangladesh bowler alleges indecent behaviour by ex-selector; BCB investigates
content: Bangladesh Cricket Board has formed a committee to probe allegations of inappropriate behaviour by a former selector against ex-pacer Jahanara Alam during the 2022 ODI World Cup. Alam detailed lewd questions and unwanted physical advances, claiming multiple officials acted improperly. The board vows swift action after a 15-day investigation.

title: Technical glitch at Delhi airport: Hundreds of flights delayed; what caused disruption
content: Hundreds of flights faced delays at Delhi's Indira Gandhi International Airport due to a technical glitch in the Air Traffic Control system. The Automatic Message Switching System crashed, forcing controllers to manually process every flight. This slowdown significantly impacted operations at India's busiest airport. Airlines warned passengers of extended waiting times. Technical teams are working to restore the system, but a timeline for normal operations remains unclear. The disruption highlights the critical reliance on automated systems in aviation.

title: IND vs AUS: 'Not Bumrah anymore': Ashwin reveals who teams will fear most in India‚Äôs T20 squad
content: India took a 2-1 lead against Australia in their T20I series. Former spinner R Ashwin highlighted Abhishek Sharma and Varun Chakaravarthy as key targets for opposition teams in the upcoming T20 World Cup. Ashwin noted Australia's effective strategy against Sharma, aiming to limit his powerful off-side shots.

title: 'Our bundle of joy': Katrina Kaif, Vicky Kaushal welcome baby boy
content: Bollywood stars Katrina Kaif and Vicky Kaushal are celebrating the arrival of their baby boy, born on November 7, 2025. The couple shared the joyous news on social media, expressing immense love and gratitude. This marks the beginning of a new chapter for the beloved pair, who had previously announced their pregnancy in September with a heartwarming picture.

title: Microsoft‚Äôs next AI leap: Superintelligence project unveiled
content: Microsoft has launched a new team dedicated to advanced AI research, led by Mustafa Suleyman. Unlike some competitors pursuing generalist AI, this "MAI Superintelligence Team" will focus on specialist models designed to solve concrete problems with virtually no existential risk. The goal is "humanist superintelligence" aimed at practical applications that benefit humanity, such as improving healthcare and detecting diseases.

title: ‚ÄòConfirmed chaal, charitra, chehra‚Äô: PK reacts to attack on Bihar dy CM‚Äôs convoy; claims ‚Äònobody safe‚Äô
content: Prashant Kishor slammed Bihar's deteriorating law and order after Deputy CM Vijay Sinha's convoy was attacked. Kishor stated Sinha's remarks confirmed the ruling NDA government's failure, asserting no one is safe. The incident saw Sinha accuse RJD supporters of stone-pelting and cow dung attacks, prompting the Election Commission to demand immediate action against miscreants.

title: Russia crude available at highest discount in a year; India, China cut purchases
content: India and China, major buyers of Russian crude, have significantly reduced their oil purchases following new US sanctions on Rosneft and Lukoil. This has widened the price gap between Russian Urals and Brent crude in Asia to a year-high, signaling increasing pressure on Russia's vital oil revenues. Refiners in both nations have halted December orders, risking unsold Russian oil volumes.

title: Babar Azam vs Virat Kohli | Pak batter makes shocking claim - 'Huge difference!'
content: Pakistani cricketer Azam Khan has drawn a comparison between Babar Azam and Virat Kohli. Khan stated Babar elevated Pakistan's batting reputation like Kohli did for India. He also noted Babar lacked support from senior players unlike Kohli. Khan believes Pakistani fans do not fully appreciate Babar's contributions. He also agreed with Suryakumar Yadav's comment on the India-Pakistan 'rivalry'.

title: Peter Thiel‚Äôs warning resurfaces: What he predicted about Zohran Mamdani?
content: Tech titan Peter Thiel warned Silicon Valley in 2020 that rising millennial support for socialism stemmed from economic hardship, not ideology.  His foresight appears validated by Zohran Mamdani's election as New York's first Muslim and South Asian mayor on a platform of housing affordability and debt relief, highlighting a growing demand for alternatives to a perceived rigged capitalist system.

title: IND vs AUS: 'Makes no sense!' Ex-India cricketer furious over Sanju Samson‚Äôs treatment
content: Aakash Chopra has criticized India's management for their inconsistent handling of Sanju Samson. Despite decent performances, Samson has been shuffled and dropped, with Jitesh Sharma now preferred. Chopra questions the logic behind Samson's exclusion, especially after his strong showings as an opener.

title: Indian MBBS student found dead in Russian dam; was missing for 19 days
content: A 22-year-old Indian MBBS student, Ajit Chaudhary, missing for 19 days from Russia's Bashkir State Medical University, was found dead in a dam near the campus. His body was identified by fellow students, ending a desperate search that began after his clothes were found on a swollen riverbank. The family had sold land to fund his education.

title: Moments after $1 trillion pay nod: Musk breaks into dance with robot ‚Äî who did it better?
content: Elon Musk celebrated a monumental Tesla payday, potentially worth $1 trillion, after shareholders overwhelmingly approved his compensation package. The deal, which could make him the world's first trillionaire, aims to secure his leadership for years, driving Tesla's ambitions in AI and robotics.  Despite controversies, investors backed Musk's vision, though critics raise concerns about concentrating so much power.

title: Zarine Khan, mother of Sussanne and Zayed, passes away at 81
content: The Bollywood fraternity is mourning the loss of a revered figure, Zarine Khan (Zarin Katrak), wife of veteran actor Sanjay Khan and mother of actor Zayed Khan, designer Sussanne Khan and Farah Khan Ali. Zarine Khan passed away peacefully today, surrounded by her family. She was 81 years old.

title: NHL trade rumors: Nazem Kadri linked to Canadiens as Penguins stay silent
content: The Pittsburgh Penguins' strong start has silenced trade rumors for their veteran stars, with GM Kyle Dubas prioritizing competitiveness and future building. Meanwhile, the Calgary Flames face uncertainty regarding Nazem Kadri's future, with his contract and past conduct raising questions about his trade value, despite interest from teams like Montreal and Carolina.

title: Aditi Mishra becomes JNU‚Äôs 1st woman president since 2019: Left sweeps all posts
content: The Left Unity panel achieved a clean sweep in the JNUSU elections, securing all four central posts for 2025-26. Aditi Mishra of AISA became the first woman president since 2019. This victory marks a significant comeback for the Left, reclaiming dominance on campus after a previous setback.

title: Watch: US strikes another vessel in eastern Pacific
content: The United States has conducted another strike on a drug vessel in the eastern Pacific, leading to two fatalities. This action is part of an ongoing maritime campaign that has resulted in at least 66 deaths. Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth shared the video and confirmed the strike targeted a vessel involved in illicit narcotics smuggling.

title: Marshawn Kneeland girlfriend: Who is Catalina, the woman who loved the late Cowboys star?
content: The NFL community mourns Marshawn Kneeland, a promising 24-year-old Dallas Cowboys defensive end. His girlfriend, Catalina, alerted police during his final moments, revealing his struggles. Their relationship was private, built on mutual respect and shared values. Catalina, an entrepreneur, was his grounding force, supporting his career and remaining a private figure even after his tragic passing.

title: Gisele B√ºndchen Says Prioritizing Tom Brady Took a Personal Toll
content: Supermodel Gisele B√ºndchen, in a candid interview, shared insights into her marriage with Tom Brady, describing their split as a 'death and rebirth.' She detailed her journey of shifting from supporting her partner's career to rediscovering her own dreams and defining personal success. B√ºndchen emphasizes her graciousness towards Brady, highlighting her focus on authenticity and fulfillment in her new chapter.

title: Security breach at Delhi airport: UK passenger from Bangkok dodges immigration
content: A significant security lapse occurred at New Delhi's Indira Gandhi International Airport (IGI) when a British national, Fitz Patrick, reportedly bypassed immigration after arriving from Bangkok. Authorities have launched a manhunt using technical and human intelligence to locate the individual, who is believed to have exited without completing mandatory checks.

title: ‚ÄòFake vote, fake photo‚Äô: Rahul‚Äôs ‚Äòwholesale chori‚Äô charge at BJP; claims party will repeat it in Bihar
content: Rahul Gandhi accused Prime Minister Narendra Modi and the BJP of electoral malpractice, alleging "chunav chori" (election theft). He claimed systematic manipulation, citing Haryana as an example of "wholesale chori" and "one man, multiple votes," and stated the Prime Minister came to power through such means.

title: 'Change it!': Ex-IND pacer wants major rule removed after Gill LBW scare; urges ICC
content: A former India all-rounder urged the ICC to change a rule after Shubman Gill's review in the India-Australia T20I. He highlighted how a successful review, despite an inside edge, results in a dot ball and potential run loss, which could be critical in close matches. He believes this rule needs immediate attention to prevent future issues.

title: Watch: Trump's guest faints during White House event; netizens slam his 'too calm' response
content: A guest fainted during a White House event on lowering obesity drug costs, causing a temporary halt. The man, Gordon Finlay, representing a pharmaceutical company, received prompt medical attention. President Trump later confirmed the guest was fine, attributing the incident to lightheadedness and the long standing time in the Oval Office.

title: 2 killed as local Mumbai train ploughs through commuters at CSMT
content: A flash protest by Central Railway employees at CSMT halted suburban services for an hour, leading to a tragic incident where two commuters died and three were injured after being hit by a train while walking on tracks. The protest was against an FIR lodged following a previous accident.

title: Groww IPO day 3: GMP softens to 11% reaching Rs 111; should you subscribe?
content: Groww's IPO is on its final bidding day, having garnered significant retail investor interest and a 1.64 times subscription by Day 2. The platform's valuation stands at 33.8 times FY25 earnings, with a Rs 11 grey market premium indicating a potential listing price of Rs 111. Brokerages largely recommend subscribing, citing Groww's strong market position and growth potential.

title: Women's World Cup: 'It still haunts me'- Alyssa Healy breaks silence on Australia‚Äôs defeat vs India
content: Australia captain Alyssa Healy admitted the heartbreaking semi-final loss to India in the ICC Women's World Cup still "hurts," despite her team's strong campaign. She believes Australia left runs on the field and struggled to adapt to the pitch conditions under lights, ultimately falling short in the knockout game.

title: Love, revenge & fake emails: How 'heartbroken' Chennai techie sent bomb threat mails to 21 schools across state to trap ex-boyfriend
content: An engineering graduate was arrested for sending bomb threat emails to 21 schools across India, including in Bengaluru and Mysuru. The accused, Rene Joshilda, allegedly used her ex-lover's name to implicate him in the crime. She was taken into Bengaluru police custody on a body warrant.

title: Gold price prediction: What's the outlook for today? Why ‚Äòbuy on dips‚Äô makes sense
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold prices are showing early recovery signs, prompting a 'buy on dips' strategy for investors. Technical indicators suggest a potential short-term trend reversal, with key support around ‚Çπ1,20,100. Analysts recommend entering around ‚Çπ1,20,600-‚Çπ1,20,700, targeting ‚Çπ1,21,800, with a breakout potentially pushing prices to ‚Çπ1,22,200.

title: CBSE to introduce global curriculum across UAE and other countries from April 2026
content: India‚Äôs Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) will introduce its Global Curriculum in April 2026, targeting CBSE-affiliated schools in the UAE and other countries. Announced at the Sahodaya School Complex conference in Dubai, the curriculum aims to combine international learning standards with Indian educational values, offering greater flexibility, global recognition, and enhanced teacher training, while aligning with NEP 2020.

title: A 480-million-year-old fossil changes what we know about the origin of parasites
content: Ancient fossils unearthed in Morocco reveal parasitic worms burrowing into mollusc shells approximately 480 million years ago, pushing back the known timeline for parasitism by 60 million years. This discovery in the Fezouata Shale formation offers a remarkable glimpse into complex early marine ecosystems, showcasing sophisticated host-parasite interactions much earlier than previously believed.

title: ‚ÄòGovinda admitted, hum kya karein?‚Äô: IPS officer D Sivanandhan reveals how actors and musicians performed a show for Dawood Ibrahim‚Äôs daughter
content: In the 1990s, Bollywood's glamour was overshadowed by underworld influence, with gangsters financing hit films like 'Satya' and 'Company' to enhance their image. Actors and producers lived under constant threat, forced to comply with demands from figures like Dawood Ibrahim, as revealed by former Joint CP Crime Mumbai D Sivanandhan.

title: They were visibly uncomfortable: Men seen forcing foreign tourists for photos on Goa beach
content: Goa authorities are cracking down on tourist harassment following disturbing incidents at Arambol and Vagator beaches.  Stricter patrolling and swift response mechanisms are being implemented to ensure visitor safety.  The tourism department emphasized that assault and intimidation will face severe action, urging establishments and visitors alike to uphold responsible conduct for a secure tourism environment.

title: Longer wait times, flight delays: Delhi airport ATC hit by technical snag; airlines issue advisory
content: Delhi Airport is experiencing significant flight delays since Thursday evening due to a software issue with the Aeronautical Message Switching System (AMSS) in air traffic control. This technical problem has slowed down flight movements, leading to stacked-up delays and impacting both departures and arrivals. Authorities are working to resolve the issue, with rectification expected by Friday evening.

title: Suryakumar Yadav loses his temper at Shivam Dube during 4th T20I vs Australia
content: India captain Suryakumar Yadav showed rare frustration during the fourth T20I against Australia. Despite this brief moment, India secured a crucial 48-run victory, leveling the series. Washington Sundar's exceptional bowling performance led to a dramatic Australian collapse, securing the win for India.

title: What really happens inside your body when you hold your breath too long
content: Scientists explored how repeated breath-holding impacts the body.  A study found that practicing breath-holding techniques significantly increases endurance.  This improvement stems from the body becoming more efficient at balancing oxygen and carbon dioxide.  The repetition itself, rather than specific techniques, conditions the body.  This physiological adaptation allows for longer holds and quicker recovery.

title: Dodgers eye $80M ex-Cubs champion to boost roster and title hopes
content: Former MVP Cody Bellinger is reportedly a target for a blockbuster reunion with the Los Angeles Dodgers. After a strong showing with the Yankees, Bellinger opted out of his contract, making him a highly sought-after free agent. His return would bolster the Dodgers' lineup and defense, potentially aiding their championship aspirations.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens below 25,400; BSE Sensex down over 450 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in red on Friday on weak global cues. While Nifty50 went below 25,400, BSE Sensex was down over 450 points.

title: Top stocks to buy: Stock recommendations for today - check list
content: Stock market recommendations:Bajaj Broking Research identifies Manappuram Finance and Dabur India as top stock picks for November 7, 2025. The Nifty is consolidating near a crucial demand zone, suggesting a healthy pullback within an uptrend.

title: 'You shut up ...': Ravi Shastri's epic advice to young Sachin amid Aussie sledging
content: Ravi Shastri recounted a fiery 1991-92 tour of Australia, advising an 18-year-old Sachin Tendulkar to let his bat do the talking amidst Australian sledging.  Shastri himself had a verbal spat with Mike Whitney, but urged Tendulkar, who was eager to retaliate, to rely on his immense talent. This advice shaped Tendulkar's legendary career against Australia.

title: Forensic Tests Confirm 17-Year-Old Killed Mexican Mayor Carlos Manzo
content: A 17-year-old boy has been confirmed as the perpetrator of the deadly shooting of Carlos Manzo, mayor of the Mexican city of Uruapan, during a public event in the state of Michoacan over the weekend, the state prosecutor's office said on Thursday.

title: Winds Shatter Window, Blow Roofs As Typhoon Kalmaegi Kills 5 In Vietnam
content: After wreaking havoc in the Philippines, Typhoon Kalmaegi brought fierce winds and torrential rains to Vietnam, where five people have been killed and many others remain missing after several houses collapsed in Gia Lai and neighbouring Dak Lak.

title: Wine Order Leaves Bitter Aftertaste As Bengaluru Man Loses Rs 17,994 In Scam
content: What was meant to be a simple attempt to order a bottle of wine for a home function turned into a bitter experience for a Bengaluru resident, who ended up losing Rs 17,994 to an online delivery scam.

title: Inside 'Anandamath': The Celebrated Book That Gave India 'Vande Mataram'
content: As India commemorates 150 years of Vande Mataram, the spotlight turns to Anandamath, the novel where Bankim Chandra Chatterjee introduced the hymn to the nation.

title: "Don't Carry Burden On Yourself": Top Court To Father Of Air India Pilot
content: No one can blame the pilot-in-command of the Air India Boeing 787 Dreamliner for the crash in Ahmedabad that killed 260, the Supreme Court told the pilot's father today and sent notices to the Centre and the civil aviation regulator DGCA.

title: West Bengal Mandates Rabindranath Tagore's State Song At School Assemblies
content: The West Bengal Board of Secondary Education issued a notification making Nobel laureate Rabindranath Tagore's 'Banglar mati, Banglar jol', the state's official song, mandatory at morning assemblies in government-aided and sponsored schools across th

title: Gujarat Horror: Dhaba Worker Forced To Lick Feet At Knifepoint, Filmed
content: Shocking visuals have emerged in Gujarat's Surat of a 26-year-old man being forced to lick another man's feet and apologise to him at knifepoint.

title: Supreme Court's Big Order On Stray Dogs, Cattle At Rail Stations, Highways
content: The Supreme Court also directed state governments, municipal authorities, and road and transport authorities to remove cattle from highways and expressways and rehabilitate them in shelters.

title: Tesla To xAI, Elon Musk's Tech Empire That Makes Him A Trillion-Dollar CEO
content: Elon Musk has secured a $1 trillion pay deal from Tesla, in what is the largest corporate pay package in history.

title: Navi Mumbai Man Beats Cousin To Death On Suspicion Of Mobile Theft
content: A 34-year-old man was beaten to death by his cousin and an aide on suspicion of stealing a mobile phone in Navi Mumbai, police said on Friday.

title: Case Against 2 UP Police Officials After Man Falls Off Roof During Raid
content: Two police personnel, including a sub-inspector, have been booked in connection with a Dalit man's death allegedly during a raid here, officials said on Thursday.

title: Major Security Lapse At Delhi Airport As UK National Flees During Layover
content: A major security lapse was reported at Delhi's Indira Gandhi International Airport last week when a British national, who arrived from Bangkok, fled the immigration counter and entered the city.

title: Nancy Pelosi To Retire After 40 years. Here Are Some Pelosi-isms
content: Nancy Pelosi is bringing her history-making career in the US House to an end, but she leaves a linguistic legacy in Congress and beyond.

title: Bankim Chandra Chatterjee: The Man Who Wrote Iconic 'Vande Mataram'
content: India's national song "Vande Mataram" marks its 150th anniversary today. Written by Bankim Chandra Chatterjee in 1875, the song went on to become a powerful symbol of India's freedom movement and national pride.

title: Confused Between Hurricane, Cyclone, Typhoon? Here's The Difference
content: They get different names in different parts of the world. Hurricane is used in the Atlantic, Caribbean Sea, central and northeast Pacific. They are typhoons in the northwest Pacific. In the Bay of Bengal and the Arabian Sea, they are called cyclones.

title: Zohran Mamdani, Sadiq Khan Face Criticism From Trump, Get Abused Over Faith
content: London's Sadiq Khan has a lot in common with New York Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani  but also many differences.

title: Request For Blanket, Bedsheet Turns Fatal, Army Soldier Killed On Train
content: According to information provided by the railways, a coach attendant, who was railway personnel, killed the soldier following an argument over a blanket and sheet.

title: Suspected Kidnapping Of Woman In Coimbatore Triggers Massive Police Search
content: A late-night alarm over the suspected kidnapping of a woman in Tamil Nadu's Coimbatore has triggered a massive police search, though officers said there is no confirmation that any woman was kidnapped.

title: CBI Case Against Ex-Punjab Top Cop, Wife Over Son's Mysterious Death
content: The CBI has registered an FIR against former Punjab DGP Mohammad Mustafa, his wife Razia Sultana and others in connection with the "murder case" of their son Aquil Akhtar (35), who was found dead under suspicious circumstances in Panchkula.
